com.stellarcommand

Class StellarOSCVocabulary.ClientMessages

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stellarcommand.StellarOSCVocabulary.ClientMessages
  • Enclosing class:
    StellarOSCVocabulary

    public final class StellarOSCVocabulary.ClientMessages
extends java.lang.Object
    ClientMessages are the messages sent from StellarCommand to the OSC client

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BUNDLE_COUNT
      The message is used to indicate the number of bundles that are being used to send all the Stellar Data for a single query.
      static java.lang.String DISPLAY_VIEW
      Notifies Client of the display being viewed in stellarium as three floats
      The OSC arguments are three floats measured in decimal degrees:
      The field of view being viewed
      The Right Ascension (Ra) of the centre of the display
      The Declination (Dec.) of the centre of the display
      static java.lang.String OBSERVATION_POINT
      The location that we are viewing for stellarium OSC arguments will be latitude, longitude.
      static java.lang.String OSC_PORT
      Notifies client of the UDP port that StellarCommand is listening to.
      static java.lang.String SCRIPT
      Sends the status of Stellarium S cript
      int - zero if not running script or non zero if a script is running
      static java.lang.String STAR_NAMES
      The list of the the column names for the data that will be in the values message
      OSC arguments will be a series of strings.
      static java.lang.String STAR_VALUES
      The data for a row of stars as floats.
      static java.lang.String STELLAR_TIME
      The time that stellarium will be displaying The format of the time will be a string
      UTC as String
      Local Time as String
      GMT Times shift as float in julian days - eg, a value of 0.5 indicates half a day ahead of GMT
      Time rate as float - Time rate multiplier.
      static java.lang.String VERSION
      Returns the version information as Major, minor and build
      Major - int
      Minor - int

    • Field Detail

      • OSC_PORT

        public static final java.lang.String OSC_PORT
        Notifies client of the UDP port that StellarCommand is listening to. The message contains a single int argumenr
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String VERSION
        Returns the version information as Major, minor and build
        Major - int
        Minor - int
        Buils - int
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISPLAY_VIEW

        public static final java.lang.String DISPLAY_VIEW
        Notifies Client of the display being viewed in stellarium as three floats
        The OSC arguments are three floats measured in decimal degrees:
        The field of view being viewed
        The Right Ascension (Ra) of the centre of the display
        The Declination (Dec.) of the centre of the display
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BUNDLE_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String BUNDLE_COUNT
        The message is used to indicate the number of bundles that are being used to send all the Stellar Data for a single query. The reason is that there could be thousands of stars being returned which would be too large to fit a single bundle.
        The OSC arguments are two integers:

        The Bundle number for this section of the data. Zero based index count - eg, first bundle will have a value of zero
        The total number of bundles for current query
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STAR_NAMES

        public static final java.lang.String STAR_NAMES
        The list of the the column names for the data that will be in the values message
        OSC arguments will be a series of strings. EG

        RArad (deg)
        DErad (deg)
        pmRA(mas/yr)
        pmDE(mas/yr)
        Hpmag (mag)
        B-V(mag)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STAR_VALUES

        public static final java.lang.String STAR_VALUES
        The data for a row of stars as floats. The column values correlate to the values in star names.
        For example, the following OSC argument 133.50998 -34.824913 -10.56 8.17 9.0556 0.042 would correlate to
        RA Dec. pmRA pmDE Hpmag ad B-V
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OBSERVATION_POINT

        public static final java.lang.String OBSERVATION_POINT
        The location that we are viewing for stellarium OSC arguments will be latitude, longitude.
        latitude - Degrees as float
        longitude - degrees as float
        altitude - meters as float
        planet - planet as string
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STELLAR_TIME

        public static final java.lang.String STELLAR_TIME
        The time that stellarium will be displaying The format of the time will be a string
        UTC as String
        Local Time as String
        GMT Times shift as float in julian days - eg, a value of 0.5 indicates half a day ahead of GMT
        Time rate as float - Time rate multiplier. Eg if we are going 2x speed will have a value of 2
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCRIPT

        public static final java.lang.String SCRIPT
        Sends the status of Stellarium S cript
        int - zero if not running script or non zero if a script is running
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
